Hi,

I have browsed the code in WorkQueueFrontier, and had a look at the JM=
X
service method frontierReport. I would like to know how I could obtain a
=
report containing exhausted and retired queues (I am especially interested
=
in knowing how much they costed). My BdbFrontier is configured as follows :=


queue-total-budget =3D -1
error-penalty-amount =3D 1
balance-replenish-am=
ount =3D 1
cost-policy =3D org.archive.crawler.frontier.ZeroCostAssignmentP=
olicy

Is this information is present in the "all" report? Maybe queues wit=
h a zero
size ?

I am using the quota enforcer to set a budget for queues :=
 we use
group-max-fetch-successes, and might also set a value for
group-max=
-success-kb.

I have also noticed that the crawl fails if I set error-penal=
ty-amount and
balance-replenish-amount to zero. Why ?

Best regards,

Nicol=
as

-- 
Nicolas Giraud
